channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
channel.desc: A look at how, in many of the earth's natural wonders, animals can be a threat to the people who live there, or they can provide a means of survival.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
channel.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri investigate two paintings of characters from the Gospels.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Call My Bluff
channel.desc: Robert Robinson presents as Frank Muir, Kate O'Mara and Godfrey Smith compete against Arthur Marshall, Victoria Wood and Tim Brooke-Taylor in a duel of words and wit.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face the Music
channel.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Patricia Owen, Brian Redhead and John Julius Norwich. With guest musician James Galway.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Black and White in Colour:...
channel.desc: Television, Memory, Race, 1936-68. Documentary that explores, through archive clips and stories of performers, the contribution made by black and Asian people to TV. First broadcast in 1992.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Black and White in Colour:...
channel.desc: Television, Memory, Race, 1968-92. Documentary, first broadcast in 1992, that traces and questions the progress made by black and Asian people on British television.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Riviera
channel.desc: Richard E Grant explores how modern art and the Riviera grew up together when the Cote D'Azur became both a hedonistic playground and an experimental studio.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Baku
channel.desc: In the final episode of the series, our intrepid cultural explorers Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke set off on their most adventurous trip yet - to Baku, capital of Azerbaijan.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
channel.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri investigate two paintings of characters from the Gospels.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
channel.desc: A look at how, in many of the earth's natural wonders, animals can be a threat to the people who live there, or they can provide a means of survival.

channel.title: This is BBC Four

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
channel.desc: A look at how people push themselves to the limit to survive in some natural wonders. We visit Brazil, Ethiopia, Laos, the Faroe Islands and the Swiss Alps.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Is Margo having an affair? When she is less than honest about her activities, the Goods can't help thinking the worst.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes Minister
channel.desc: Sitcom about a British government minister. Jim Hacker finds himself in possession of embarrassing information about the sale of arms to terrorists.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Oh Doctor Beeching!
channel.desc: Harry the signalman has fattened up a lovely turkey in time for Christmas, but the turkey seems to have other plans.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Dad's Army
channel.desc: Classic sitcom. Captain Mainwaring encourages the women of Walmington-on-Sea to join the platoon and meets Mrs Gray, an attractive middle-aged widow.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Signalman
channel.desc: Charles Dickens's ghost story in which a lonely signalman is haunted by a hooded figure who seems to warn of danger.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Murder on the Victorian Railway
channel.desc: Documentary looking at the first murder on Britain's railways. On a Hackney bound train in 1864, a guard discovers blood in a first-class carriage and a body on the embankment.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Joy of (Train) Sets
channel.desc: Documentary exploring the British love for model railways.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Engine that Powers the World
channel.desc: The story of the hidden powerhouse behind the globalised world, the diesel engine.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Murder on the Victorian Railway
channel.desc: Documentary looking at the first murder on Britain's railways. On a Hackney bound train in 1864, a guard discovers blood in a first-class carriage and a body on the embankment.

channel.title: Earth's Natural Wonders
channel.desc: A look at how people push themselves to the limit to survive in some natural wonders. We visit Brazil, Ethiopia, Laos, the Faroe Islands and the Swiss Alps.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Last Days of Steam
channel.desc: Documentary that tells the surprising story of how Britain entered a new age of steam railways after the Second World War and why it quickly came to an end.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Great Railway Journeys
channel.desc: to Crewe with Victoria Wood. 1/7. Victoria Wood makes a round trip to the north of Britain from Crewe.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: London to Brighton
channel.desc: In 1953, the BBC made a point-of-view film from the London-Brighton train. In 1983, they did it again. This film shows both concurrently, with every bridge, tunnel and station.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Great Railway Journeys:...
channel.desc: Confessions of a Trainspotter. 5/8. Self-confessed railway enthusiast Michael Palin travels from Euston in London to the Kyle of Lochalsh, along routes steeped in history.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Phil Davis Remembers... The Firm
channel.desc: Phil Davis pays tribute to maverick director Alan Clarke as he looks back on his time acting in the 1989 made-for-television film The Firm.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Firm - Screen Two
channel.desc: Drama about a seemingly respectable estate agent who is also a football hooligan. Contains very strong language, graphic violence and upsetting scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Why the Industrial Revolution Happened Here
channel.desc: Professor Jeremy Black explains the unique economic, social and political factors that helped Britain transform itself almost entirely by the 19th century.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Last Days of Steam
channel.desc: Documentary that tells the surprising story of how Britain entered a new age of steam railways after the Second World War and why it quickly came to an end.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Steam Days
channel.desc: First transmitted in 1986, Miles Kington travels across the western Highlands on one of the most picturesque railways in Britain, from Fort William to Mallaig.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Train Now Departing
channel.desc: Programme from 1988 that examines the events surrounding the proposed closure of the Settle to Carlisle line, one of the most magnificent stretches of railway in England.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Brief Encounter
channel.desc: A chance meeting in a railway station brings together two married people.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Sarah Churchwell Remembers... The Great Gatsby
channel.desc: Sarah Churchwell looks at the origins and inspiration behind F Scott Fitzgerald's novel.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Great Gatsby
channel.desc: Film drama. In the volatile era of the twenties, flamboyant millionaire Jay Gatsby pursues the seductive Daisy, the love he lost while serving in the First World War.
